sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The dialogues of S. Gregorie, surnamed the Greate: Pope of Rome: and the first of that name deuided into fower bookes. Wherein he intreateth of the liues, and miracles of the saintes in Italie: and of the eternitie of mens soules. With a shorte treatise of sundry miracles, wrought at the shrines of martyrs: taken out of S. Augustin. Together with a notable miracle wrought by S. Bernard, in confirmation of diuers articles of religion. Translated into our English tongue by P.W. Dialogi. Part 1. English Gregory I, Pope, ca. 540-604. Woodward, Philip, ca. 1557-1610. Augustine, Saint, Bishop of Hippo. De civitate Dei. Book 22. Chapter 8. English.
[48], 514, [2]; 48 p.
By Charles Boscard], Printed at Paris [i.e. Douai : 1608.
A translation of part 1 of "Dialogi". P.W. = Philip Woodward. Actual place of publication and printer's name from STC. "A shorte relation of diuers miracles" (a translation of "De civitate Dei", book 22, chapter 8) has separate pagination, and dated title page on 2A1. Title page line 15 ends "Bernard"; dedication signed "P.W.". Variant 1: title page line 15 ends "Bernar-". Variant 2: dedication signed "Philippe Woodwarde". Reproduction of the original in Harvard University. Library.
=======
The dialogues of S. Gregorie, surnamed the Greate: Pope of Rome: and the first of that name deuided into fower bookes. Wherein he intreateth of the liues, and miracles of the saintes in Italie: and of the eternitie of mens soules. With a shorte treatise of sundry miracles, wrought at the shrines of martyrs: taken out of S. Augustin. Together with a notable miracle wrought by S. Bernard, in confirmation of diuers articles of religion. Translated into our English tongue by P.W. Dialogi. Part 1. English Gregory I, Pope, ca. 540-604. Woodward, Philip, ca. 1557-1610. Augustine, Saint, Bishop of Hippo. De civitate Dei. Book 22. Chapter 8. English.
[48], 514, [2]; 48 p.
By Charles Boscard], Printed at Paris [i.e. Douai : 1608.
A translation of part 1 of "Dialogi". P.W. = Philip Woodward. Actual place of publication and printer's name from STC. "A shorte relation of diuers miracles" (a translation of "De civitate Dei", book 22, chapter 8) has separate pagination, and dated title page on 2A1. Title page line 15 ends "Bernard"; dedication signed "P.W.". Variant 1: title page line 15 ends "Bernar-". Variant 2: dedication signed "Philippe Woodwarde". Reproduction of the original in Harvard University. Library.
Charles Boscard]
